trans-unit.source: Query Entities
trans-unit.target: Query Entities

trans-unit.source: Query Entities
trans-unit.target: Query Entities

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation queries entities in a table and includes the <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>$select</languageKeyword> options.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation queries entities in a table and includes the <languageKeyword>$filter</languageKeyword> and <languageKeyword>$select</languageKeyword> options.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: For requests using the <languageKeyword>$select</languageKeyword> query option, the request must be made using version 2011-08-18 or later.
trans-unit.target: For requests using the <languageKeyword>$select</languageKeyword> query option, the request must be made using version 2011-08-18 or later.

trans-unit.source: In addition, the <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference> headers must be set to <system>2.0</system>.
trans-unit.target: In addition, the <parameterReference>DataServiceVersion</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>MaxDataServiceVersion</parameterReference> headers must be set to <system>2.0</system>.

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request may be constructed as follows.

trans-unit.source: HTTPS is recommended.
trans-unit.target: HTTPS is recommended.

trans-unit.source: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account, and <parameterReference>mytable</parameterReference> with the name of your table:
trans-unit.target: Replace <placeholder>myaccount</placeholder> with the name of your storage account, and <parameterReference>mytable</parameterReference> with the name of your table:

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: The address of the entity set to be queried may take a number of forms on the request URI.
trans-unit.target: The address of the entity set to be queried may take a number of forms on the request URI.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link>.

trans-unit.source: Emulated Storage Service URI
trans-unit.target: Emulated Storage Service URI

trans-unit.source: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Table service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10002</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:
trans-unit.target: When making a request against the emulated storage service, specify the emulator hostname and Table service port as <codeInline>127.0.0.1:10002</codeInline>, followed by the emulated storage account name:

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: HTTP Version
trans-unit.target: HTTP Version

trans-unit.source: HTTP/1.1
trans-unit.target: HTTP/1.1

trans-unit.source: The Table service in the storage emulator differs from the Windows® Azure™ Table service in several ways.
trans-unit.target: The Table service in the storage emulator differs from the Windows® Azure™ Table service in several ways.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c60f2090-c0f4-4817-8559-e98786461dbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Differences Between the Storage Emulator and Azure Storage Services</legacyLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <legacyLink xlink:href="c60f2090-c0f4-4817-8559-e98786461dbe" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Differences Between the Storage Emulator and Azure Storage Services</legacyLink>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation supports the query options defined by the OData Protocol Specification.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation supports the query options defined by the OData Protocol Specification.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <externalLink><linkText>OData Protocol</linkText><linkUri>http://www.odata.org/</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.target: The following table describes required and optional request headers.

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: Specifies the authentication scheme, account name, and signature.

trans-unit.target: <parameterReference>Date</parameterReference> or <parameterReference>x-ms-date</parameterReference>

trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.target: Specifies the accepted content type of the response payload.

trans-unit.source: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.
trans-unit.target: Provides a client-generated, opaque value with a 1 KB character limit that is recorded in the analytics logs when storage analytics logging is enabled.

trans-unit.source: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.
trans-unit.target: Using this header is highly recommended for correlating client-side activities with requests received by the server.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="1727932c-8a3b-4502-86ac-c89931d54bac" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">About Storage Analytics Logging</link> and <externalLink><linkText>Azure Logging: Using Logs to Track Storage Requests</linkText><linkUri>http://blogs.msdn.com/b/windowsazurestorage/archive/2011/08/03/windows-azure-storage-logging-using-logs-to-track-storage-requests.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link> and <link xlink:href="a34b70ea-3b69-406e-9b1e-660358d997a3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Table Storage Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="4421ac96-38eb-4ea3-8104-f9975c3bf153" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link> and <link xlink:href="a34b70ea-3b69-406e-9b1e-660358d997a3" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Table Storage Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response header
trans-unit.target: Response header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: If the number of entities to be returned exceeds 1,000, if the server timeout interval is exceeded, or if the query crosses the partition boundary, the response header includes the <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey</parameterReference> continuation headers.
trans-unit.target: If the number of entities to be returned exceeds 1,000, if the server timeout interval is exceeded, or if the query crosses the partition boundary, the response header includes the <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextPartitionKey</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>x-ms-continuation-NextRowKey</parameterReference> continuation headers.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the continuation tokens, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the continuation tokens, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.

trans-unit.source: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.
trans-unit.target: This header uniquely identifies the request that was made and can be used for troubleshooting the request.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="b20a45d8-7453-487c-b492-69dc5a5b6d2d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Troubleshooting API Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the version of the Table service used to execute the request.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the version of the Table service used to execute the request.

trans-unit.source: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.
trans-unit.target: This header is returned for requests made against version 2009-09-19 and later.

trans-unit.source: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.
trans-unit.target: A UTC date/time value generated by the service that indicates the time at which the response was initiated.

trans-unit.source: Indicates the content type of the payload.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the content type of the payload.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header depends on the value of the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> request header.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header depends on the value of the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> request header.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: For more information about valid content types, see <link xlink:href="9f1dce4a-d528-40ec-a5a4-fd93f9ee4c5e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload Format for Table Service Operations</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about valid content types, see <link xlink:href="9f1dce4a-d528-40ec-a5a4-fd93f9ee4c5e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Payload Format for Table Service Operations</link>.

trans-unit.source: Sample Response
trans-unit.target: Sample Response

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns the list of entities in a table as an OData entity set, either in a JSON or an Atom feed, depending on the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> header of the request.
trans-unit.target: The <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation returns the list of entities in a table as an OData entity set, either in a JSON or an Atom feed, depending on the <parameterReference>Accept</parameterReference> header of the request.

trans-unit.source: Here is a sample request URI for a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation on a Customers table.
trans-unit.target: Here is a sample request URI for a <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>Query Entities</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> operation on a Customers table.

trans-unit.source: And here is the response body for an Atom feed:
trans-unit.target: And here is the response body for an Atom feed:

trans-unit.source: The JSON response feed is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The JSON response feed is as follows:

trans-unit.source: No Metadata:
trans-unit.target: No Metadata:

trans-unit.source: Minimal Metadata:
trans-unit.target: Minimal Metadata:

trans-unit.source: Full Metadata:
trans-unit.target: Full Metadata:

trans-unit.source: Authorization
trans-unit.target: Authorization

trans-unit.source: This operation can be performed by the account owner and by anyone with a shared access signature that has permission to perform this operation.
trans-unit.target: This operation can be performed by the account owner and by anyone with a shared access signature that has permission to perform this operation.

trans-unit.source: A query against the Table service may return a maximum of 1,000 entities at one time and may execute for a maximum of five seconds.
trans-unit.target: A query against the Table service may return a maximum of 1,000 entities at one time and may execute for a maximum of five seconds.

trans-unit.source: If the result set contains more than 1,000 entities, if the query did not complete within five seconds, or if the query crosses the partition boundary, the response includes custom headers containing a set of continuation tokens.
trans-unit.target: If the result set contains more than 1,000 entities, if the query did not complete within five seconds, or if the query crosses the partition boundary, the response includes custom headers containing a set of continuation tokens.

trans-unit.source: The continuation tokens may be used to construct a subsequent request for the next page of data.
trans-unit.target: The continuation tokens may be used to construct a subsequent request for the next page of data.

trans-unit.source: For more information about continuation tokens, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about continuation tokens, see <link xlink:href="d962e4c0-709a-4f04-a296-32a49d82c799" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Timeout and Pagination</link>.

trans-unit.source: For projection requests using the <languageKeyword>$select</languageKeyword> query option, the request must be made using version 2011-08-18 or newer.
trans-unit.target: For projection requests using the <languageKeyword>$select</languageKeyword> query option, the request must be made using version 2011-08-18 or newer.

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of returned properties is 255, and all projected properties will be included in the response body even if the property is not part of the returned entity.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of returned properties is 255, and all projected properties will be included in the response body even if the property is not part of the returned entity.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the request includes a property that the projected entity does not contain, the missing property is marked with a null attribute.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the request includes a property that the projected entity does not contain, the missing property is marked with a null attribute.

trans-unit.source: The sample response body above includes the Address property, which is not part of the projected entity, so the property is null: <codeInline>%%amp;lt;d:Address m:null=”true” /%%amp;gt;</codeInline>
trans-unit.target: The sample response body above includes the Address property, which is not part of the projected entity, so the property is null: <codeInline>%%amp;lt;d:Address m:null=”true” /%%amp;gt;</codeInline>

trans-unit.source: The total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including the five seconds for query execution.
trans-unit.target: The total time allotted to the request for scheduling and processing the query is 30 seconds, including the five seconds for query execution.

trans-unit.source: Note that the right-hand side of a query expression must be a constant; you cannot reference a property on the right-hand side of the expression.
trans-unit.target: Note that the right-hand side of a query expression must be a constant; you cannot reference a property on the right-hand side of the expression.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link> for details on constructing query expressions.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="74e73539-b624-4f47-8603-112cbb6780db" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Querying Tables and Entities</link> for details on constructing query expressions.

trans-unit.source: A query expression may not contain <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> values.
trans-unit.target: A query expression may not contain <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> values.

trans-unit.source: The following characters must be encoded if they are to be used in a query string:
trans-unit.target: The following characters must be encoded if they are to be used in a query string:

trans-unit.source: Forward slash (/)
trans-unit.target: Forward slash (/)

trans-unit.source: Question mark (?)
trans-unit.target: Question mark (?)

trans-unit.source: Colon (:)
trans-unit.target: Colon (:)

trans-unit.source: 'At' symbol (@)
trans-unit.target: 'At' symbol (@)

trans-unit.source: Ampersand (&)
trans-unit.target: Ampersand (&)

trans-unit.source: Equals sign (=)
trans-unit.target: Equals sign (=)

trans-unit.source: Plus sign (+)
trans-unit.target: Plus sign (+)

trans-unit.source: Comma (,)
trans-unit.target: Comma (,)

trans-unit.source: Dollar sign ($)
trans-unit.target: Dollar sign ($)

trans-unit.source: Any application that can authenticate and send an HTTP <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GET</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request can query entities in a table.
trans-unit.target: Any application that can authenticate and send an HTTP <unmanagedCodeEntityReference>GET</unmanagedCodeEntityReference> request can query entities in a table.

trans-unit.source: For more information about supported query operations against the Table service through LINQ, see <link xlink:href="de258a1e-4101-4443-88cb-f9d156f04246" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Operators (Table Storage Support)</link> and <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about supported query operations against the Table service through LINQ, see <link xlink:href="de258a1e-4101-4443-88cb-f9d156f04246" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Query Operators (Table Storage Support)</link> and <link xlink:href="c1ff6980-6c93-4327-9d19-69790370e1ee" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Writing LINQ Queries</link>.
